intro: Phalangium quamash, commonly known as the western hognose snake, is a species of snake native to the western United States. It is characterized by its distinctive upturned snout and keeled scales. The snake's coloration varies, often featuring a reddish-brown body with darker markings. It is a secretive and nocturnal species, typically found in arid and semi-arid environments. Phalangium quamash plays an important role in its ecosystem as both predator and prey.
